intro: Verlotia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf verlotia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to elliptical, and its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing fragrant, pink or white flowers. Verlotia heterophylla is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils.
